    • Method Detail

      • createFile

        public static java.io.File createFile​(java.io.File file)
                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                      java.lang.SecurityException,
                                      java.io.IOException
        Creates a new File instance by converting the given pathname string into an abstract pathname. If the given string is the empty string, then the result is the empty abstract pathname.
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:
        File (if created or already existed) or null if could not create for any reason
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method does not permit verification of the existence of the named directory and all necessary parent directories; or if the checkWrite method does not permit the named directory and all necessary parent directories to be created; or if a security manager exists and its checkWrite method denies write access to the file

      • createFile

        public static boolean createFile​(java.io.File file,
                                 long length)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                 java.lang.SecurityException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Creates a new File instance by converting the given pathname string into an abstract pathname. If the given string is the empty string, then the result is the empty abstract pathname.
        The file will be created with the length size.
        This method only changes FileSystem if the pathname given does not exists.
        Parameters:
        file -
        length - the size of the file
        Returns:
        True if could create the file with the specific length
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the length argument is less then zero
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method does not permit verification of the existence of the named directory and all necessary parent directories; or if the checkWrite method does not permit the named directory and all necessary parent directories to be created; or if a security manager exists and its checkWrite method denies write access to the file

                                                          java.lang.String charset)
                                                   throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                          java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                                          java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                          java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                          java.io.IOException
        Gives a buffered character-output stream that uses a default-sized output buffer.
        This method uses createFile(String) to try to create if doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        file -
        append - if true, then bytes will be written to the end of the file rather than the beginning
        charset - name of a supported charset @return BufferedWriter @throws UnsupportedEncodingException If the named encoding is not supported @throws FileNotFoundException If the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurred
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method does not permit verification of the existence of the named directory and all necessary parent directories; or if the checkWrite method does not permit the named directory and all necessary parent directories to be created; or if a security manager exists and its checkWrite method denies write access to the file
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • createPathForFile

        public static boolean createPathForFile​(java.io.File file)
                                 throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Just verifies if the path to file exists, if not tries make it.
        Parameters:
        file - An abstract representation of file and directory pathnames
        Returns:
        boolean true if exists or had been created
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method does not permit verification of the existence of the named directory and all necessary parent directories; or if the checkWrite method does not permit the named directory and all necessary parent directories to be created

                                  java.lang.SecurityException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Writes binary data to a file, all at once.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the data to write
        file -
        append - if true, then bytes will be written to the end of the file rather than the beginning

      • readAllAtOnce

        public static byte[] readAllAtOnce​(java.io.File file)
                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   java.lang.SecurityException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Reads binary data from a file, all at once.
        The content can not have more then Integer.MAX_VALUE of length.
        Parameters:
        file - an abstract representation of file and directory pathnames
        Returns:
        the content of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading.
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file
        java.io.IOException - If the first byte cannot be read for any reason other than end of file, or if the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs

                            throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                   java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   java.lang.SecurityException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Reads binary data from a file, all at once.
        The content can not have more then Integer.MAX_VALUE of length.
        Parameters:
        filename - a pathname string
        Returns:
        the content of the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading.
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file
        java.io.IOException - If the first byte cannot be read for any reason other than end of file, or if the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs

      • exists

        public static boolean exists​(java.lang.String filename)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                             java.lang.SecurityException
        Verifies whether the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname exists.
        Parameters:
        filename - a pathname string
        Returns:
        true If and only if the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname exists; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file or directory

      • getFileSize

        public static long getFileSize​(java.lang.String filename)
                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                               java.lang.SecurityException
        Returns the length of the file denoted by this abstract pathname. The return value is unspecified if this pathname denotes a directory.
        Parameters:
        filename - a pathname string
        Returns:
        the length, in bytes, of the file denoted by this abstract pathname, or 0L if the file does not exist. Some operating systems may return 0L for pathnames denoting system-dependent entities such as devices or pipes
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the filename argument is null
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file

      • md5

        public static byte[] md5​(java.io.File file)
                  throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                         java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                         java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Calculates the MD5 of a file.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be opened for reading
        Returns:
        the array of bytes for the resulting hash value
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if no Provider supports a MessageDigestSpi implementation for the specified algorithm
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file
        java.io.IOException - if the first byte cannot be read for any reason other than the end of the file, if the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs

        Returns:
        the array of bytes for the resulting hash value
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the filename argument is null
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if no Provider supports a MessageDigestSpi implementation for the specified algorithm
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist, is a directory rather than a regular file, or for some other reason cannot be opened for reading
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its checkRead method denies read access to the file
        java.io.IOException - if the first byte cannot be read for any reason other than the end of the file, if the input stream has been closed, or if some other I/O error occurs

      • rename

        public static boolean rename​(java.lang.String fromFilename,
                             java.lang.String toFilename)
                      throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                             java.lang.NullPointerException
        Renames the file denoted by this abstract pathname fromFilename to abstract pathname toFilename.

        Many aspects of the behavior of this method are inherently platform-dependent: The rename operation might not be able to move a file from one filesystem to another, it might not be atomic, and it might not succeed if a file with the destination abstract pathname already exists.
        The return value should always be checked to make sure that the rename operation was successful.
        Parameters:
        fromFilename - the abstract pathname of the named file to rename
        toFilename - the new abstract pathname for the named file
        Returns:
        true if and only if the renaming succeeded; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its SecurityManager.checkWrite(java.lang.String) method denies write access to either the old or new pathnames
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter fromFilename or toFilename is null

      • rename

        public static boolean rename​(java.io.File fromFile,
                             java.lang.String toFilename)
                      throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                             java.lang.NullPointerException
        Renames the file denoted by fromFile to abstract pathname toFilename.

        Many aspects of the behavior of this method are inherently platform-dependent: The rename operation might not be able to move a file from one filesystem to another, it might not be atomic, and it might not succeed if a file with the destination abstract pathname already exists.
        The return value should always be checked to make sure that the rename operation was successful.
        Parameters:
        fromFile - the file to rename
        toFilename - the new abstract pathname for the named file
        Returns:
        true if and only if the renaming succeeded; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its SecurityManager.checkWrite(java.lang.String) method denies write access to either the old or new pathnames
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter fromFile or toFilename is null

      • delete

        public static boolean delete​(java.io.File file)
                      throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Deletes the file or directory denoted by this abstract pathname. If this pathname denotes a directory, then the directory must be empty in order to be deleted.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if and only if the file or directory is successfully deleted; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its SecurityManager.checkDelete(java.lang.String) method denies delete access to the file

      • delete

        public static boolean delete​(java.lang.String filename)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                             java.lang.SecurityException
        Deletes the file or directory denoted by filename pathname. If this pathname denotes a directory, then the directory must be empty in order to be deleted.
        Parameters:
        filename - a pathname string
        Returns:
        true if and only if the file or directory is successfully deleted; false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the filename argument is null
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its SecurityManager.checkDelete(java.lang.String) method denies delete access to the file

      • generateFileFrom

        public static java.io.File generateFileFrom​(java.io.File path,
                                            long number)
        Creates a File, which is a sub directory of path with the patern ./directory/filename.ext from the long number.

        2..2'333'1111

        1111 - directory / 2..2 - filename . 333 - extension
        Parameters:
        number -
        Returns:
        path
